title: Check the URL property verification result

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Request message type. Allowed format: application/json .

parameters.name: app_id
parameters.description: ID of your developer application. To find the App ID , navigate to My Apps > App Detail > Basic Information .

parameters.name: url_property_meta
parameters.description: Information about the URL property that you want to check the ownership verification result for.

parameters.name: property_type
parameters.description: Type of the URL property. Enum valuesï¼š 1: Domain. 2: URL prefix.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: An owned URL that you want to check the ownership verification result for. Pass in the URL according to the property_type that you specify. If property_type is 1, you need to specify a base domain (for example, example.com ) or a subdomain (for example, subdomain.example.com ). If property_type is 2, you need to specify a URL prefix which consists of: https:// + host (must be a domain) + path + / , and should not include any redirections to other URLs. For instance, in the URL prefix https://www.example.com/folder/ , the host is the domain www.example.com and the path is /folder . Note : Pass to this field a URL property that you have added to the advertiser account through /business/property/add/ . Otherwise, an error will occur. Note that subdomains of a verified domain do not require separate verification, because they are automatically considered verified.
